person.persName: John Cardwell (Breathitt County, Kentucky, farmer, postmaster, and justice of the peace)

body.p: Breathitt County, Kentucky, farmer, postmaster, and justice of the peace.Virginia native. Married to Araminta W. Watkins Cardwell on May 13, 1823. Father of John W. Cardwell, William D. Cardwell, Maranda Cardwell, Isaac N. Cardwell, Thomas Cardwell, A. Edward Cardwell, and Araminta Cardwell. Private in Captain John Brock's Company of the 4th Regiment of East Tennessee Militia during the War of 1812. U.S. postmaster in Breathitt County from 1849 to 1851 and 1853 to 1857. Owned one enslaved person in 1860. Merchant in Breathitt County in 1860. Tavern house keeper in Breathitt County in 1860. Justice of the peace in Breathitt County in 1864.
